business.headline: HUL's Nitin Paranjape shares dramatic account of company's 5-lakh store leapNitin Paranjpe recalled proposing the addition of five lakh outlets, a number he admitted sounded unrealistic at first.

Why is Zerodha's Nithin Kamath warning investors against pre-IPO hype?With IPO buzz at its peak, Nithin Kamath has stepped in to warn investors about the increasing speculation in the unlisted market, where many buyers are chasing inflated pre-IPO valuations.

How do you recover money after credit card fraud? Steps you must knowRecovering money after credit card fraud can feel stressful, but the process is simpler if you act quickly. Knowing the right steps — and your rights, can greatly improve your chances of getting your money back.

India's GDP rises by 8.2% in Q2 despite Trump tariffs, highest in six quartersIndia's 8.2% Q2 GDP print has beaten forecasts despite pressure from US tariffs, with manufacturing and services driving momentum and reaffirming the nation's place as the fastest-growing major economy heading into FY26.

Sensex, Nifty end flat as Dalal Street takes breather after hitting all-time highsThe S&P BSE Sensex slipped 13.71 points to close at 85,706.67, while the NSE Nifty50 ended 12.60 points lower at 26,202.95. The broader market also remained subdued, with most major sectoral indices finishing in the red.

Are millennials relying too heavily on SIPs for wealth building?Millennials swear by SIPs for long term investing, but are they mistaking convenience for safety? As market cycles turn unpredictable, is it time to rethink what "safe investing" really means?

From tax deadlines to LPG, pensions: 5 major financial changes starting December 1Before December begins, it's worth noting that several new financial rules will kick in, affecting your bills, savings and even travel plans. Whether it's cooking gas, pension rules or tax filings, here's what to expect as the calendar turns.

Sudeep Pharma shares rise nearly 29% over IPO price. What should investors do?Sudeep Pharma's strong debut has impressed investors, but with valuations now stretched, is this the right moment to book profits or should investors stay put and ride the long-term story?

From GMP to price band: 5 things to know about Meesho IPOThe SoftBank-backed e-commerce platform has set a price band of Rs 105 to Rs 111 per share, valuing the company at nearly Rs 50,100 crore at the upper end.

Will your pension stop after November 30? Check nowThe deadline to submit the annual Life Certificate is almost here, and missing it could put your pension on hold. Pensioners must complete the process by 30 November to avoid any interruption.

New labour codes bring major employee benefits, but what are the big challenges?The new labour codes promise stronger protection and wider benefits for workers, but the real test begins now as businesses brace for higher costs, major restructuring and a challenging transition across sectors.

Why is tax department sending SMS alerts to 25,000 taxpayers about foreign assets?Tax officials examined data received from foreign jurisdictions through the Automatic Exchange of Information (AEOI) system. This international framework allows countries to share details of financial accounts held abroad by their residents.

Meesho IPO opening on December 3: What investors need to knowMeesho IPO is all set to open for subscription, backed by strong GMP cues and rising investor interest, but can the value-commerce giant turn pre-listing hype into sustained market performance? Here is all you need to know.

Is your money lying unclaimed? Here's how Delhi's new campaign help you recover itThe move is part of the Centre's ongoing 'Apki Punji, Apka Adhikar' campaign, which focuses on returning such funds to their rightful owners.

Sudeep Pharma makes strong market debut. Hold or book profit now?A blockbuster debut has rewarded Sudeep Pharma IPO investors. Should you cash out while sentiment is high or hold on for the company's expansion and export growth story?

Sudeep Pharma shares list at 23% premium in strong market debutThe Rs 895-crore issue, which was subscribed an extraordinary 93.71 times between November 21 and 25, opened at Rs 730 on the NSE and Rs 725 on the BSE, against the upper-end IPO price of Rs 593.

GAIL share price tumbles 6%. Here's why the PSU stock is falling todayThe slump in GAIL's share price reflects investor disappointment over a tariff hike that landed far below expectations. With a full review pushed to 2028, the market is recalibrating its outlook on earnings support for the PSU major.
Sensex, Nifty take breather after hitting record highsThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 65.92 points at 85,786.30 around 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 16.65 points to 26,232.20.

Why Zerodha's Nithin Kamath says crypto derivatives need urgent regulationKamath described the current state of crypto derivative exchanges as "a bit like Schrödinger's cat — neither fully regulated nor unregulated."

entertainment.headline: Rajinikanth fan's emotional journey to meet the superstar goes viral. Watch A video of a Rajinikanth fan detailing his experience meeting the superstar and obtaining his autograph has gained widespread attention on social media. The fan's story comes as Rajinikanth was recently honoured for 50 years in cinema at the 56th International Film Festival of India.

Vijay Varma shares surreal moment after receiving Gulzar Saab's signed note Vijay Varma called it a "surreal" moment after receiving autographs and heartfelt encouragement from the legendary Gulzar Saab, a gesture he took days to process before sharing publicly.

Deepika's sister Anisha reportedly to wed Rohan Acharya, related to Deols, Bimal Roy Deepika Padukone's sister Anisha Padukone is reportedly preparing to marry Rohan Acharya. Here's how the wedding will connect the Padukone family to the Deols and the lineage of renowned filmmaker Bimal Roy.

Anupam Kher recalls the time when he laughed for eight hours straight Veteran actor Anupam Kher recently shared hilarious stories from his youth involving marijuana and bhaang on a recent podcast, and spoke of the effects that led him to avoid such substances thereafter.

Tillotama Shome-Jim Sarbh's Goa holiday photos are trending. See pics Actors Tillotama Shome and Jim Sarbh have sparked dating rumours after sharing candid photos from their Goa vacation on Instagram, showing cosy and fun moments together. Fans quickly flooded the comments, speculating about a possible romance between the two Bollywood stars.

Yami Gautam celebrates 37th birthday on film set, shares warm thank you note Yami Gautam celebrated her 37th birthday on set and shared a heartfelt note saying "working birthdays are one of the best," thanking fans and well-wishers for their love.

Jaya Bhattacharya on abusive childhood: Forced to act; beaten with hunter, shoes Jaya Bhattacharya opened up about her traumatic childhood, sharing years of physical abuse from her mother and the impact of her parents' toxic marriage.

Randeep Hooda and Lin Laishram announce pregnancy on 2nd wedding anniversary Randeep Hooda and Lin Laishram announced that they are expecting their first child as they marked their second wedding anniversary with a heartfelt Instagram post. The couple shared a dreamy bonfire picture and expressed their joy, calling their baby "a little wild one on the way."

Choreographer Nandika on cheating claims after Smriti–Palaash wedding is put on hold Choreographer Nandika Dwivedi has denied cheating allegations after rumours linked her to Smriti Mandhana and Palash Muchhal's wedding being put on hold.

Superstar Rajinikanth wins hearts as he poses with paps at IFFI 2025 red carpet Superstar Rajinikanth lit up the IFFI 2025 red carpet as he greeted and posed with paps, drawing massive attention from fans and media.

Vir Das turns lyricist to highlight Mumbai pollution with a witty song. Video Vir Das turned lyricist to highlight Mumbai's worsening smog, posting a witty song with lines like "AQI, AQI, let me die" that has humour with the city's pollution woes.

Tere Ishk Mein box office Day 1: Dhanush-Kriti Sanon's film earns Rs 16.50 crore Tere Ishk Mein, starring Dhanush and Kriti Sanon, opened strongly at the box office with a Rs 16.50 crore collection on Day 1, supported by solid occupancy across major cities.

Salman Khan says he endorsed cardamom, not gutkha, in pan masala ad row Salman Khan told the Kota Consumer Court that he endorsed only silver-coated cardamom and "not gutkha," as he faced allegations of promoting misleading pan masala ads. The complaint also questioned the authenticity of his signatures and raised concerns about celebrity responsibility in influencing young consumers.

BB19 turns dull-dirty: Ashnoor lashes out, Pranit slips, show sinks before finale Bigg Boss 19 hits a surprising slump just a week before the finale as top contestants lose their spark. Ashnoor's outburst to Pranit's unexpected spiral, it feels unusually dull.

Ahaan-Aneet recreate Saiyaara's iconic scene at Delhi event, video goes viral Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda set social media buzzing after recreating their iconic Saiyaara scene at a Delhi award event, delighting fans with their chemistry. The breakout stars, honoured as Gen Z Icons, continue to soar with blockbuster success and upcoming projects.

Akshaye Khanna shares fan's savage post calling out audience hypocrisy Akshaye Khanna sparked buzz by sharing a fan's sarcastic post calling out audience hypocrisy ahead of Dhurandhar's release. His repost went viral as the film's intense first look heightened excitement.

Rangeela at 30: Does the trendsetter superhit survive new-age scrutiny? As Rangeela's 4K restoration lights up screens this November 28, Cinematic Saturday looks at the blueprint that changed it all, while analysing if its tropes pass in 2025?

Bigg Boss 19 episode 97: Malti kicks Farrhana, Pranit roasts Tanya and others The latest episode of 'Bigg Boss 19' saw Malti Chahar kicking Farrhana Bhatt amid an argument. Pranit More hosted his weekly comedy session, in which he roasted Tanya Mittal and others.

David Beckham meets Samantha and Dhanush in Mumbai, sparks social media buzz Football legend David Beckham, currently in Mumbai as UNICEF Goodwill Ambassador, was seen meeting Indian actors Samantha Ruth Prabhu and Dhanush on Friday. Their encounters drew attention both at an event and on social media.

general news.headline: There will be jihad if oppression happens: Jamiat chief's shocking remarkJamiat Ulema-e-Hind chief Mahmood Madani triggered a political storm by saying "if there is oppression, there will be jihad," while accusing the judiciary and government of undermining minority rights.

Live: Heavy rain in Tamil Nadu, Andhra ahead of Cyclone Ditwah landfallCyclone Ditwah Live Updates: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) informed that Cyclonic Storm Ditwah is moving toward the Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and south Andhra Pradesh coast, and is likely to make landfall on November 30. The storm had earlier struck Sri Lanka's eastern coast on Friday morning, leaving over 120 people dead and causing extensive damage as it moved northwest toward India. PM Modi offered condolences to those who lost loved ones and wished a swift recovery for the affected communities. The system remains classified as a cyclonic storm with no indication of strengthening further. Tamil Nadu has issued a red alert for four districts and an orange alert for five others ahead of its arrival. Follow indiatoday.in for live updates.

At Oxford, Pak claims victory against India in debate never meant to be heldPakistan claimed that the Indian side pulled out of the Oxford Union debate, but connecting the dots suggests the debate was never meant to happen. It was a staged stunt, designed to show Indians as unwilling to engage in an open debate. Oxford Union President Moosa Harraj, the son of the Pakistani defence production minister, used the good ol' cheating playbook of Pakistan.

We're united: Siddaramaiah, Shivakumar's bonhomie after breakfast meetSiddaramaiah and DK Shivakumar used a high-command-prompted breakfast meeting in Bengaluru to project unity, discuss 2028 election strategy and dismiss speculation of a leadership rift in Karnataka.

Anthony Albanese marries Jodie Haydon, is 1st Australian PM to be hitched in officeAnthony Albanese has married his partner of five years, Jodie Haydon, at a ceremony at the prime minister's official residence in Canberra.

Airbus A320 glitch causes airlines in India to scramble, 400 aircraft may be hitAsserting that safety is their top priority, Air India and IndiGo said they have completed updates on 40% and 80% of their A320-family aircraft, respectively, and are confident of completing the entire fleet within the timeline set by EASA.

Who killed 3 Chinese gold miners? Pakistan, Taliban push own theoriesAfter an armed drone attack on a China-linked gold mine in Tajikistan killed three Chinese nationals, Dushanbe described the perpetrators as "criminal groups" from a neighbouring country. While Afghanistan blamed a "circle" creating "chaos, instability, and distrust in the region" for the attack, Pakistan quickly jumped in, accusing the Taliban regime of Afghanistan.

Oxford debate fiasco unfolds with Indian, Pak sides trading blame over walkoutWhile Supreme Court lawyer J Sai Deepak provided a concrete timeline of events, the Pakistan High Commission in the UK claimed that the Indian delegation withdrew at the last moment, lacking "confidence," even without an iota of proof.

How the Sun grounded 6,000 Airbus planes globallyAirlines worldwide cancelled and delayed flights as they worked to patch software on a widely used Airbus flight, after an analysis indicated that a software flaw code may have contributed to a sudden loss of altitude in a recent incident.

Buzz over Smriti, Palash's Instagram bio update amid wedding delayIndia batter Smriti Mandhana and her fiancé Palash Muchhal have postponed their wedding due to her father's health scare. The couple updated their Instagram bios with a nazar emoji amid social media rumours about their personal lives.

Bengaluru man quits corporate job to drive auto, explains why in inspiring videoA Bengaluru man left his corporate job and found peace and happiness in driving an auto-rickshaw, which he shared in an honest video about his new life on Instagram.
From Serenity to Celebration - Gujarat in All Its ShadesAnother destination that has stood the test of time and modernisation is Vadnagar.

Delhi man, 27, shot dead minutes before his birthday, attacker on the runThe victim, Gagan, was shot in the head near his home in Delhi's Shahdara minutes before his birthday. Police say the attacker fired two more rounds in the air before escaping.

India overpower Canada 14–3 to enter Sultan Azlan Shah Cup finalIndia's men's hockey team sweeps Canada aside 14-3, clinching a place in the Sultan Azlan Shah Cup final through swift, relentless attacking and a flurry of goals that highlight clinical finishing.

Indian restaurants are now also lecture halls, art classes, theatres and whatnotWould you go to a restaurant for a cooking class, to paint a mug, to watch a movie, or to attend a cool lecture? Read how and why Indian restaurants are doubling up as culture centres again.

US sets $200,000 loan cap for 11 graduate degrees under new 2026 rulesThe United States is preparing one of the most significant changes to graduate lending in more than a decade. The new framework will reshape borrowing limits, programme categories and access to federal loans for thousands of students.

US man swaps traditional Thanksgiving spread with Indian food. Here's the menuAn American man replaced the traditional Thanksgiving meal with an Indian feast, bringing the all-time classics like chicken tikka and biryani to the table.

sports.headline: 1st ODI predicted XI: Pant vs Ruturaj  for middle-order spot in Ranchi? India (IND) vs South Africa (SA), 1st ODI predicted playing XI: With KL Rahul confirming he will continue to bat at No. 6, India have a few middle-order spots to fill. Yashasvi Jaiswal is expected to open with Rohit Sharma, while either Ruturaj Gaikwad or Rishabh Pant could slot in at No. 4.

Mark Wood set to miss 2nd Ashes Test in Brisbane due to knee injury: Report England fast bowler Mark Wood is likely to miss the second Ashes Test due to knee soreness. The first Test in Perth marked Wood's first competitive appearance since the Champions Trophy in February, where he bowled 11 overs in the match.

Rohit, Kohli bring a different type of energy when playing in India: Temba Bavuma IND vs SA ODIs: South Africa's captain, Temba Bavuma, believes that both Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli bring a different type of energy, especially when playing in front of a home crowd, a challenge the Proteas skipper is looking forward to in the upcoming series.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli make dressing room feel more confident: KL Rahul India vs South Africa: KL Rahul, speaking to the press on the eve of the first ODI, welcomed the return of Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli, emphasising their importance in the dressing room. The stand-in captain also discussed the team combination, with the likes of Rishabh Pant and Ruturaj Gaikwad available. Rahul further acknowledged the fading ability of India's Test batters to play spin.

KL Rahul hints MS Dhoni could come to Ranchi ODI, lift crowd and team's energy India's stand in captain KL Rahul has said that MS Dhoni's attendance at the Ranchi for the first ODI against South Africa is expected to boost team spirit and excite fans alike.

Indian batters have a problem vs spin, willing to learn from ex-players: KL Rahul India vs South Africa: Speaking to the press on the eve of the Ranchi ODI, KL Rahul admitted that Indian batters are struggling against spin in Test cricket. The senior campaigner said the players are open to learning from former greats who were masters of playing spin.

Rishabh Pant good enough to play as a specialist batter: KL Rahul before Ranchi ODI IND vs SA: KL Rahul said Rishabh Pant is fully capable of playing as a specialist batter in the Ranchi ODI but confirmed that if Pant is in the XI, he will take the wicketkeeping gloves.

When in MS Dhoni sir's team, definition of success changes: Gujarat's Urvil Patel Urvil Patel has been retained by Chennai Super Kings for the IPL 2026 season. The aggressive wicketkeeper-batter began the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy tournament with a 31-ball hundred for Gujarat against Services on November 26.

After dream WPL deal, 20-year-old Australia pacer stuns with career-best WBBL spell Milly Illingworth earned her maiden WPL deal with the Mumbai Indians and celebrated it by producing her best-ever WBBL spell of 3 for 19 for the Melbourne Renegades.

Usman Khawaja asked to explain Perth pitch comments by Cricket AustraliaAustralian opener Usman Khawaja has been called to explain his criticism of the Perth Stadium pitch, following remarks made after the first Ashes Test against England. Cricket Australia officials expressed dissatisfaction with Khawaja's comments, which described the surface in negative terms, despite the match referee rating it as 'very good.'

No Bumrah for home Tests? Ashwin, AB de Villiers send India pacer big messageFormer India all rounder Ravichandran Ashwin and former South Africa batter AB de Villiers have advised fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah to focus more on white-ball cricket and play only the crucial Test matches for India. Bumrah has been rested for three-match Test series against South Africa.

Watch: Virat Kohli rock solid in intense nets session before 1st ODI vs South AfricaIND vs SA: Veteran batter Virat Kohli looked in superb touch during an intense Ranchi nets session, signalling strong form and confidence ahead of the first ODI against South Africa.

Ayush Mhatre shatters Rohit Sharma's record after blistering century in SMATAyush Mhatre broke Rohit Sharma's record to become the youngest player to score centuries in all three formats of cricket. He achieved the feat  after scoring his maiden T20 century for Mumbai in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.

Ben Stokes hits back at critics: Call England rubbish, but not arrogantAshes, AUS vs ENG: Skipper Ben Stokes defended England after a heavy eight-wicket loss, insisting the team isn't arrogant and vowing to fight back in the five-match series.

MI vs RCB kicks off blockbuster season as BCCI announces full scheduleThe WPL 2026 will begin on January 9 with defending champions Mumbai Indians facing Royal Challengers Bengaluru, featuring 20 league matches across Navi Mumbai and Vadodara, following an auction where 67 of 277 players were sold for Rs 40.8 crore.

Umran Malik vows to make India comeback, adds new tricks beside 150 kph speedUmran Malik remains confident of an India comeback as he rediscovers form and adds new skills to complement his 150 kph pace. The speedster is currently playing for Jammu and Kashmir in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy.

Rohit Sharma nears 20K international runs, eyes historic landmarkIND vs SA: Rohit Sharma enters the South Africa ODI series on the verge of two historic milestones, reaching 20,000 international runs and becoming the first batter to hit 650 sixes.

DRS: Who is responsible for the lowest point in Indian cricket?India's losses in two home series in two years have forced the cricketing fans into an uncomfortable question – who is responsible for this mess? Is it the selectors, the coach or the current crop of players who have failed to live up to their positions?

Ro-Ko's India return, new opening duo? What to look forward to in IND vs SA ODIsIND vs SA: After a bruising Test series loss at home, India look to their stalwarts Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli to restore authority in the ODI series against South Africa. However, the Ro-Ko return will not be all to look forward to for fans in the ODI series.

Jaiswal or Gaikwad? Who should open with Rohit Sharma in South Africa ODI series?IND vs SA: As India look to bounce back in the ODI series after a 0-2 Test defeat to South Africa, the absence of Shubman Gill opens a chance for Ruturaj Gaikwad and Yashasvi Jaiswal to secure the spot as the backup opener of the side.

Jemimah Rodrigues opens up on dealing with anxiety during ODI World CupIndia batter Jemimah Rodrigues has opened up on facing anxiety throughout the ODI World Cup campaign. Jemimah delved deep into the problems she faced and how she finally came out of it.

India thrash Chile 7-0 to open Junior Hockey World Cup campaign in styleRosan Khujur and Dilraj Singh starred as India began their Junior Hockey World Cup campaign in dominant fashion, thrashing Chile 7-0 to underline their title ambitions in front of the home crowd.

International cricketer jailed for punching woman and stealing her phone: ReportPapua New Guinea cricketer Kiplin Doriga has been sentenced to three years in jail for robbery in Jersey. The case raises concerns about athlete conduct during international tours.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
